instruction: Read the fragment and explain what type of conflict is being described.
input: John and Mark had been good friends since they were children. Now they were adults, they had different beliefs and interests. Yet, they were both determined to reach their goals, whatever the cost.
output: This is an example of a conflict between two friends due to differing beliefs. Despite their differences, both John and Mark are determined to reach their goals, suggesting that this is a conflict of principles, with each person believing that their way is the best path. It also suggests that they are willing to go to great lengths to accomplish their goals, regardless of their friendship and differences.
